title: Rest
description: Defines a rest service using the rest-dsl

apiDocs.title: Api Docs
apiDocs.description: Whether to include or exclude this rest operation in API documentation. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level. The default value is true.

bindingMode.title: Binding Mode
bindingMode.description: Sets the binding mode to use. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is auto

clientRequestValidation.title: Client Request Validation
clientRequestValidation.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check: 1) Content-Type header matches what the Rest DSL consumes; returns HTTP Status 415 if validation error. 2) Accept header matches what the Rest DSL produces; returns HTTP Status 406 if validation error. 3) Missing required data (query parameters, HTTP headers, body); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error. 4) Parsing error of the message body (JSon, XML or Auto binding mode must be enabled); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error.

consumes.title: Consumes
consumes.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input), such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this REST service from the route during build time. Once an REST service has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

enableCORS.title: Enable CORS
enableCORS.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is false.

enableNoContentResponse.title: Enable No Content Response
enableNoContentResponse.description: Whether to return HTTP 204 with an empty body when a response contains an empty JSON object or XML root object. The default value is false.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

openApi.title: Open Api
openApi.description: To use an existing OpenAPI specification as contract-first for Camel Rest DSL.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path of the rest service, such as /foo

produces.title: Produces
produces.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output), such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

securityDefinitions.title: Security Definitions
securityDefinitions.description: Sets the security definitions such as Basic, OAuth2 etc.

securityRequirements.title: Security Requirements
securityRequirements.description: Sets the security requirement(s) for all endpoints.

skipBindingOnErrorCode.title: Skip Binding On Error Code
skipBindingOnErrorCode.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc, as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

tag.title: Tag
tag.description: To configure a special tag for the operations within this rest definition.

apiDocs.title: Api Docs
apiDocs.description: Whether to include or exclude this rest operation in API documentation. The default value is true.

bindingMode.title: Binding Mode
bindingMode.description: Sets the binding mode to use. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is off

clientRequestValidation.title: Client Request Validation
clientRequestValidation.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check: 1) Content-Type header matches what the Rest DSL consumes; returns HTTP Status 415 if validation error. 2) Accept header matches what the Rest DSL produces; returns HTTP Status 406 if validation error. 3) Missing required data (query parameters, HTTP headers, body); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error. 4) Parsing error of the message body (JSon, XML or Auto binding mode must be enabled); returns HTTP Status 400 if validation error.

consumes.title: Consumes
consumes.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input), such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.description: Marks this rest operation as deprecated in OpenApi documentation.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this REST service from the route during build time. Once an REST service has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

enableCORS.title: Enable CORS
enableCORS.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is false.

enableNoContentResponse.title: Enable No Content Response
enableNoContentResponse.description: Whether to return HTTP 204 with an empty body when a response contains an empty JSON object or XML root object. The default value is false.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

outType.title: Out Type
outType.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from POJO to output for the outgoing data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The name of the class of the input data. Append a to the end of the name if you want the input to be an array type.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path mapping URIs of this REST operation such as /{id}.

produces.title: Produces
produces.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output), such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

routeId.title: Route Id
routeId.description: Sets the id of the route

skipBindingOnErrorCode.title: Skip Binding On Error Code
skipBindingOnErrorCode.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc, as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

to.title: To
to.description: The Camel endpoint this REST service will call, such as a direct endpoint to link to an existing route that handles this REST call.

type.title: Type
type.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from input to POJO for the incoming data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level. The name of the class of the input data. Append a to the end of the name if you want the input to be an array type.

org.apache.camel.model.rest.OpenApiDefin.title: Open Api
org.apache.camel.model.rest.OpenApiDefin.description: To use OpenApi as contract-first with Camel Rest DSL.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable all the REST services from the OpenAPI contract from the route during build time. Once an REST service has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

missingOperation.title: Missing Operation
missingOperation.description: Whether to fail, ignore or return a mock response for OpenAPI operations that are not mapped to a corresponding route.

mockIncludePattern.title: Mock Include Pattern
mockIncludePattern.description: Used for inclusive filtering of mock data from directories. The pattern is using Ant-path style pattern. Multiple patterns can be specified separated by comma.

routeId.title: Route Id
routeId.description: Sets the id of the route

specification.title: Specification

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: The scopes to allow (separate multiple scopes by comma)

org.apache.camel.model.rest.ParamDefinit.title: Param
org.apache.camel.model.rest.ParamDefinit.description: To specify the rest operation parameters.

allowableValues.title: Allowable Values
allowableValues.description: Sets the parameter list of allowable values (enum).

arrayType.title: Array Type
arrayType.description: Sets the parameter array type. Required if data type is array. Describes the type of items in the array.

org.apache.camel.model.rest.ResponseMess.title: Response Message
org.apache.camel.model.rest.ResponseMess.description: To specify the rest operation response messages.

code.title: Code
code.description: The response code such as a HTTP status code

org.apache.camel.model.ToDefinition.title: To
org.apache.camel.model.ToDefinition.description: Sends the message to a static endpoint

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: Sets the optional ExchangePattern used to invoke this endpoint

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: Sets the uri of the endpoint to send to.

variableReceive.title: Variable Receive
variableReceive.description: To use a variable to store the received message body (only body, not headers). This is handy for easy access to the received message body via variables. Important: When using receive variable then the received body is stored only in this variable and not on the current org.apache.camel.Message .

variableSend.title: Variable Send
variableSend.description: To use a variable as the source for the message body to send. This makes it handy to use variables for user data and to easily control what data to use for sending and receiving. Important: When using send variable then the message body is taken from this variable instead of the current Message , however the headers from the Message will still be used as well. In other words, the variable is used instead of the message body, but everything else is as usual.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

inCookie.title: In Cookie
inCookie.description: To use a cookie as the location of the API key.

inHeader.title: In Header
inHeader.description: To use header as the location of the API key.

inQuery.title: In Query
inQuery.description: To use query parameter as the location of the API key.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the header or query parameter to be used.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

org.apache.camel.model.rest.BearerTokenD.title: Bearer Token
org.apache.camel.model.rest.BearerTokenD.description: Rest security bearer token authentication definition

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

format.title: Format
format.description: A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

org.apache.camel.model.rest.MutualTLSDef.title: Mutual TLS
org.apache.camel.model.rest.MutualTLSDef.description: Rest security mutual TLS authentication definition

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

authorizationUrl.title: Authorization Url
authorizationUrl.description: The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This SHOULD be in the form of a URL. Required for implicit and access code flows

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: The flow used by the OAuth2 security scheme. Valid values are implicit, password, application or accessCode.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

refreshUrl.title: Refresh Url
refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: The available scopes for an OAuth2 security scheme

tokenUrl.title: Token Url
tokenUrl.description: The token URL to be used for this flow. This SHOULD be in the form of a URL. Required for password, application, and access code flows.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description for security scheme.

key.title: Key
key.description: Key used to refer to this security definition

url.title: Url
url.description: OpenId Connect URL to discover OAuth2 configuration values.

org.apache.camel.model.rest.ResponseHead.title: Response Header
org.apache.camel.model.rest.ResponseHead.description: To specify the rest operation response headers.

allowableValues.title: Allowable Values
allowableValues.description: Sets the parameter list of allowable values.

arrayType.title: Array Type
arrayType.description: Sets the parameter array type. Required if data type is array. Describes the type of items in the array.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the parameter. This option is mandatory.
